Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Concomitant Tricuspid Valve Repair in Moderate Tricuspid Regurgitation During Left-Sided Valve Surgery

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included studies comparing outcomes of mitral/aortic valve surgery with or without CTR for functional TR.

Intervention.evidence: This study aims to compare clinical outcomes of patients undergoing left-sided valve procedures with or without CTR.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to compare clinical outcomes of patients undergoing left-sided valve procedures with or without CTR.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was cardiac mortality, and secondary outcomes included overall mortality, stroke, wound infection, reoperation, atrial fibrillation, renal failure, intensive care stay, and permanent pacemaker implantation.

Result_Outcome.evidence: CTR significantly reduced cardiac mortality (p < 0.0001) despite longer CPB (p < 0.00001) and X-Clamp times (p < 0.00001).

Harms.evidence: No differences were observed in stroke, wound infection, atrial fibrillation, renal failure, or intensive care stay.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.
